multiple-choice.question: What was the narrator's lifelong goal as a geologist and underwater mapper?

options.label: A

options.label: D

title: Oxygen’s surprisingly complex journey through your body - Enda Butler

multiple-choice.question: How many times do you breathe in per day?

What is the function of the alveoli in the lungs?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase the contact area for oxygen diffusion

title: How do focus groups work? - Hector Lanz

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of a focus group in market research?

options.label: B
options.text: To gather qualitative insights into consumer preferences and thoughts

options.label: C
options.text: To test the effectiveness of a new product or advertisement

options.label: B
options.text: They are too time-consuming to analyze

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of researchers can influence participants' answers

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: How do focus groups typically work?

options.text: Participants are asked to complete a survey or questionnaire

options.label: B
options.text: Participants are asked to respond to prompts from a group moderator

options.label: C
options.text: Participants are asked to engage in a group discussion without a moderator

options.label: D
options.text: Participants are asked to complete a task or activity without any guidance

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a product that was developed as a result of focus group research?

title: Why do people get so anxious about math? - Orly Rubinsten

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of the population is estimated to suffer from math anxiety?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Being told that math is challenging and unfamiliar

options.label: D
options.text: Having a teacher with math anxiety

options.label: D

title: What makes a poem … a poem? - Melissa Kovacs

multiple-choice.question: What is considered the shortest poem ever, as delivered by Muhammad Ali in 1975?

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: From the ancient Greek word "poiesis," meaning to speak

title: What is McCarthyism? And how did it happen? - Ellen Schrecker

options.label: D

title: Everything you need to know to read Homer's "Odyssey" - Jill Dash

multiple-choice.question: How was the "Odyssey" originally composed and performed?

options.label: A
options.text: It was written down in its current form by a single author.

options.label: B
options.text: It was composed before the Greek alphabet appeared and performed by oral poets called rhapsodes.

options.label: C
options.text: It was created by multiple authors over several centuries.

options.label: D
options.text: It was passed down through generations by word of mouth.

multiple-choice.question: What is the meaning of the word "rhapsode"?

options.label: A
options.text: A type of ancient Greek poetry.

options.label: B
options.text: A poet who recites from memory.

options.label: C
options.text: Stitching together, referring to the combining of existing stories into a single narrative.

options.label: D
options.text: A type of ancient Greek music.

multiple-choice.question: What is the major theme uniting both the "Iliad" and the "Odyssey"?

options.label: A
options.text: The power of love and relationships.

options.label: B
options.text: The importance of honor and loyalty.

options.label: C
options.text: Do not incur the wrath of the gods.

options.label: D
options.text: The struggle between fate and free will.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ancient code of hospitality referred to in the "Odyssey"?

options.label: A
options.text: At the beginning of the Trojan War.

options.label: B
options.text: In the middle of things, ten years after the Trojan War.

options.label: C
options.text: At the end of Odysseus's journey, when he returns home.

options.label: D
options.text: With the story of Odysseus's childhood.
